original: @245b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @245b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: badzra yo gi n'i s'a dha nam n'a ma /
analyzed: badzra yo gi n'i s'a dha nam n'a ma /
translated: Vajrayoginisādhana-nāma

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i sgrub thabs zhes bya ba /
analyzed: rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i sgrub thabs zhes bya ba /
translated: The Means of Achievement Called “Vajrayoginī”

original: rje btsun dpal rdo rje phag mo la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rje btsun dpal rdo rje phag mo la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the glorious venerable Vajravārāhī.

original: dang por rnal 'byor pa blo dang ldan pas theg pa chen po gsang sngags kyi don gang dang gang du bsdu ba de sngon du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: dang por rnal 'byor pa blo dang ldan pas theg pa chen po gsang sngags kyi don gang dang gang du bsdu ba de sngon du shes par bya ste /
translated: First, the wise practitioner should understand what is to be included in each of the topics of the Mahāyāna mantra.

original: chos thams cad ni lung dang bcas pa /🔽lung de yang gdams ngag dang bcas pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni lung dang bcas pa / lung de yang gdams ngag dang bcas pa /
translated: All dharmas are endowed with scripture.🔽That scripture is endowed with oral instructions.

original: gdams ngag de yang brgyud pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: gdams ngag de yang brgyud pa dang bcas pa /
translated: Those oral instructions are endowed with a lineage.

original: brgyud pa de yang byin rlabs dang bcas pa /
analyzed: brgyud pa de yang byin rlabs dang bcas pa /
translated: That lineage is endowed with blessings.

original: de rnams ni theg pa chen po gsang sngags kyi dngos grub nye bar thob pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni theg pa chen po gsang sngags kyi dngos grub nye bar thob pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Those are the causes for attaining the siddhis of the Mahāyāna mantra.

original: de'i rjes la bla ma'i zhal las rten gyi gang zag gcig gi cha rkyen shes par bya /
analyzed: de'i rjes la bla ma'i zhal las rten gyi gang zag gcig gi cha rkyen shes par bya /
translated: After that, one should understand the conditions of a single person who is a support from the guru’s instruction.

original: sgrub pa'i dus ni mar ngo'i tshes bcu'am /
analyzed: sgrub pa'i dus ni mar ngo'i tshes bcu'am /
translated: The time for practice is the tenth day of the waning phase of the moon.

original: yar ngo'i tshes bcu'am gnam stong ngo //🔽yid dang mthun pa'i gnas ni dang po byin @246a * //
analyzed: yar ngo'i tshes bcu'am gnam stong ngo // yid dang mthun pa'i gnas ni dang po byin @246a * //
translated: on the tenth day of the waxing or waning moon, or on the full moon day.🔽The place should be agreeable, and first

original: rlabs can gyi gnas nyid du brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rlabs can gyi gnas nyid du brtag par bya'o //
translated: one should examine it to see if it is a place of blessings.

original: de'i rjes la gnas bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la gnas bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: After that, one should protect the place.

original: de nas rnal 'byor pa stan bde bar 'dug ste /
analyzed: de nas rnal 'byor pa stan bde bar 'dug ste /
translated: Then the yogī should sit on a comfortable seat,

original: dgon pa kha nub tu blta ba'am /
analyzed: dgon pa kha nub tu blta ba'am /
translated: facing west in the wilderness,

original: yang na rnal 'byor ba kha nub tu blta /
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor ba kha nub tu blta /
translated: or the yogī should face west,

original: yang na nub tu blta ba'i mos pa bya /
analyzed: yang na nub tu blta ba'i mos pa bya /
translated: or one should imagine facing west.🔽This is the first cause for the attainment of siddhi,

original: de ni dang po au rgyan nas dar ba dang // dngos grub nye bar 'thob pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de ni dang po au rgyan nas dar ba dang // dngos grub nye bar 'thob pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: and the cause for the attainment of siddhi that is near.

original: de'i rjes la padma bha nydza na dum bu gcig pa'am /
analyzed: de'i rjes la padma bha nydza na dum bu gcig pa'am /
translated: After that, one should place a pill of nectar in a lotus flower,

original: gnyis pa'am / gsum pa'am /
analyzed: gnyis pa'am / gsum pa'am /
translated: whether it has one, two, or three segments,

original: rin po che'i snod gang yang rung ba dpa' bo'i btung bas gang ba de'i nang du bdud rtsi'i ri lu blugs par bya'o //
analyzed: rin po che'i snod gang yang rung ba dpa' bo'i btung bas gang ba de'i nang du bdud rtsi'i ri lu blugs par bya'o //
translated: or in any precious vessel filled with the hero’s drink.

original: de nas mdun du bzhag la rnal 'byor bas phung po dang khams dang skye mched sgyu ma rmi lam lta bu skad cig gis dmigs par bya //
analyzed: de nas mdun du bzhag la rnal 'byor bas phung po dang khams dang skye mched sgyu ma rmi lam lta bu skad cig gis dmigs par bya //
translated: Then, having placed it in front, the yogī should visualize the aggregates, elements, and sense bases as being like an illusion or dream.

original: de nas lag pa g-yas g-yon gnyis la aa dang ram gnyis yongs su gyur pa las /
analyzed: de nas lag pa g-yas g-yon gnyis la aa dang ram gnyis yongs su gyur pa las /
translated: Then, on the right and left hands, one should visualize two A Raṃs,

original: nyi zla gnyis ni bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: nyi zla gnyis ni bsam par bya'o //
translated: which transform into the sun and moon.

original: de'i dbus su ae wa gnyis kyi mtha' ma a'a li k'a lis bskor ba bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su ae wa gnyis kyi mtha' ma a'a li k'a lis bskor ba bsam par bya'o //
translated: In the middle of those, one should visualize two E Vaṃs, surrounded by the A Li Ka Li.

original: de rnams 'od du zhu ba bdud rtsir gyur pa snod du blugs //
analyzed: de rnams 'od du zhu ba bdud rtsir gyur pa snod du blugs //
translated: Those all melt into light and become nectar, which is poured into the vessel.

original: de nas snod de lag pa g-yas su blangs la g-yon pa'i srin lag gis chos 'byung gi dbus su bam bri /
analyzed: de nas snod de lag pa g-yas su blangs la g-yon pa'i srin lag gis chos 'byung gi dbus su bam bri /
translated: Then, having taken that vessel in the right hand, one should draw a vaṃ in the center of the source of phenomena with the ring finger of the left hand.

original: aom a'a: h'um /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um /
translated: Om āḥ hūṃ.

original: gsum gyis byin gyis brlab /
analyzed: gsum gyis byin gyis brlab /
translated: Consecrate with those three.

original: srin lag g-yon pas bdud rtsi'i zer ma phyogs bcur gtor /
analyzed: srin lag g-yon pas bdud rtsi'i zer ma phyogs bcur gtor /
translated: With the ring finger of the left hand, scatter the nectar rays in the ten directions.

original: de'i tshe sku gsung thugs kyi sngags bzlas /
analyzed: de'i tshe sku gsung thugs kyi sngags bzlas /
translated: At that time, recite the mantras of awakened body, speech, and mind.

original: bdud rtsi'i zer ma de mkha' 'gro ma'i bdag nyid 'phro bar bsam /
analyzed: bdud rtsi'i zer ma de mkha' 'gro ma'i bdag nyid 'phro bar bsam /
translated: Imagine that the nectar rays radiate out in the form of ḍākinīs.

original: des bgegs dang bar du gcod pa thams cad bsal la gnas pa dang rnal 'byor byin gyis brlab /
analyzed: des bgegs dang bar du gcod pa thams cad bsal la gnas pa dang rnal 'byor byin gyis brlab /
translated: That will clear away all obstacles and hindrances and bless the place and the yogi.

original: de'i rjes la bdud rtsi myangs la /🔽aom a'a: h'um /
analyzed: de'i rjes la bdud rtsi myangs la / aom a'a: h'um /
translated: After that, taste the elixir

original: gsum gyis sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab po //
analyzed: gsum gyis sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab po //
translated: and bless the body, speech, and mind with the three syllables: oṃ āḥ hūṃ.

original: de'i rjes la skye mched drug byin gyis brlab pa ni /
analyzed: de'i rjes la skye mched drug byin gyis brlab pa ni /
translated: After that, the blessing of the six sense bases is as follows:

original: aom bam badzra b'a r'a h'i lte ba la'o //
analyzed: aom bam badzra b'a r'a h'i lte ba la'o //
translated: oṃ vaṃ vajravārāhī at the navel.

original: ham aa mi ni snying gar ro //🔽hram mom mo hi ni kha la'o //
analyzed: ham aa mi ni snying gar ro // hram mom mo hi ni kha la'o //
translated: haṃ amina at the heart.🔽hram mom mohinī at the mouth.

original: hrem hrim tsa la ni mgo la'o //
analyzed: hrem hrim tsa la ni mgo la'o //
translated: hrem hriṃ caṇḍālī on the head.

original: h'um h'um sam tr'a sa ni spyi gtsug tu'o //
analyzed: h'um h'um sam tr'a sa ni spyi gtsug tu'o //
translated: hūṃ hūṃ saṃtrāsana on the crown of the head.

original: phat phat tsandi ka ni lus thams cad la'o //
analyzed: phat phat tsandi ka ni lus thams cad la'o //
translated: phaṭ phaṭ caṇḍikā on the whole body.

original: de rnams kyi go cha bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi go cha bya'o //
translated: One should don the armor of those.

original: mdun du mandala gru bzhi'i dbus su zlum por byas la /
analyzed: mdun du mandala gru bzhi'i dbus su zlum por byas la /
translated: In front, make a square maṇḍala, and in the center make a circle.

original: tsandan dmar po la sogs pa'i dri zhim po rnam par sna tshogs dang gong du dpa' bo btung ba byug par bya /
analyzed: tsandan dmar po la sogs pa'i dri zhim po rnam par sna tshogs dang gong du dpa' bo btung ba byug par bya /
translated: Smear it with various sweet scents such as red sandalwood, and smear it with the hero’s drink mentioned above.

original: lag pa @246b g-yon pa'i srin lag gi dbus su chos 'byung nyis brtsegs kyi gzugs bri /
analyzed: lag pa @246b g-yon pa'i srin lag gi dbus su chos 'byung nyis brtsegs kyi gzugs bri /
translated: In the middle of the ring finger of the left hand, draw the form of a double-stacked source of phenomena.

original: chos 'byung gi dbus su bam bri /
analyzed: chos 'byung gi dbus su bam bri /
translated: In the middle of the source of phenomena, draw a vaṃ.

original: me tog gcig dbus su bzhag la bsrung bar bya /
analyzed: me tog gcig dbus su bzhag la bsrung bar bya /
translated: Place one flower in the middle and protect it.

original: aom raksha raksha h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom raksha raksha h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Oṃ rakṣa rakṣa hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ svāhā.

original: zhes so // de nas sems bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes so // de nas sems bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Then generate the mind.

original: de'i rjes la me tog sngon ma blangs la go cha'i sngags kyis rim pa bzhin du me tog bkram /
analyzed: de'i rjes la me tog sngon ma blangs la go cha'i sngags kyis rim pa bzhin du me tog bkram /
translated: After that, take the previous flower and, with the armor mantra, scatter the flowers in sequence.

original: dbus su rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i sku rgyan cha lugs dang ldan pa ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs par bya /
analyzed: dbus su rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i sku rgyan cha lugs dang ldan pa ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs par bya /
translated: In the middle, visualize Vajrayoginī’s form with all the ornaments and attire just as they are.

original: mtha' ma lha mo drug ni dmar dang / ser dang nag dang sngo dang ljang dang dud ka'o //
analyzed: mtha' ma lha mo drug ni dmar dang / ser dang nag dang sngo dang ljang dang dud ka'o //
translated: The six goddesses at the end are red, yellow, black, blue, green, and smoke-colored.

original: de yang zhal gcig phyag gnyis na rdo rje gri gug dang thod pa dang kha tv'am ga bsnams pa /
analyzed: de yang zhal gcig phyag gnyis na rdo rje gri gug dang thod pa dang kha tv'am ga bsnams pa /
translated: They have one face and two hands, holding a vajra flaying knife and skull cup and embracing a khaṭvāṅga.

original: zhabs g-yas brkyang g-yon bskum pa'i tshul du rgyan dang ldan par dmigs pa bya /
analyzed: zhabs g-yas brkyang g-yon bskum pa'i tshul du rgyan dang ldan par dmigs pa bya /
translated: Visualize them in the posture of right leg drawn in and left extended, adorned with ornaments.

original: de'i rjes la phyag 'tshal /
analyzed: de'i rjes la phyag 'tshal /
translated: After that, make prostrations.

original: mchod pa dbul /
analyzed: mchod pa dbul /
translated: Make offerings.

original: mchod pa'i sngags ni /
analyzed: mchod pa'i sngags ni /
translated: The mantra for making offerings is:

original: aom a'a: h'um /🔽aargham pra t'i tstsha h'um sv'a h'a /🔽aom badzra pushpe a'a: h'um sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um / aargham pra t'i tstsha h'um sv'a h'a / aom badzra pushpe a'a: h'um sv'a h'a /
translated: oṃ āḥ hūṃ🔽arghaṃ pratīccha hūṃ svāhā🔽oṃ vajra puṣpe āḥ hūṃ svāhā

original: aom badzra h'um pe a'a: h'um sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom badzra h'um pe a'a: h'um sv'a h'a /
translated: oṃ vajra hūṃ pheb āḥ hūṃ svāhā

original: aom badzra a'a lo ke a'a: sv'a h'a /🔽aom badzra gandhe a'a: h'um sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom badzra a'a lo ke a'a: sv'a h'a / aom badzra gandhe a'a: h'um sv'a h'a /
translated: oṃ vajra āloke āḥ svāhā🔽oṃ vajra gandhe āḥ hūṃ svāhā

original: aom badzra ni bidya a'a: h'um sv'a h'a /
analyzed: aom badzra ni bidya a'a: h'um sv'a h'a /
translated: oṃ vajra nivedye āḥ hūṃ svāhā

original: zhes mchod pa byas la sdig pa bshags pa dang / phyis mi bgyid pa'i sdom pa 'dzin pa dang / gzhan gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba la rjes su yi rang ba dang / rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba byang chub tu bsngo ba dang / skyabs su 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: zhes mchod pa byas la sdig pa bshags pa dang / phyis mi bgyid pa'i sdom pa 'dzin pa dang / gzhan gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba la rjes su yi rang ba dang / rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba byang chub tu bsngo ba dang / skyabs su 'gro ba dang /
translated: Having made offerings, confess your misdeeds, take the vow not to commit them again, rejoice in the roots of virtue of others, dedicate your own roots of virtue to awakening, go for refuge,

original: lam 'dzin pa dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bskyal ba dang / mya ngan las mi 'da' bar gsol ba gdab pa dang lus dbul ba ni phyi'i mchod pa'o //
analyzed: lam 'dzin pa dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar bskyal ba dang / mya ngan las mi 'da' bar gsol ba gdab pa dang lus dbul ba ni phyi'i mchod pa'o //
translated: The outer offerings are: the path, generating the mind of enlightenment, requesting the turning of the wheel of Dharma, requesting not to pass into nirvana, and offering one's body.

original: gsang ba'i mchod pa ni gong gi bdud rtsi la sogs pas rtsa ba'i sngags dang go cha dang rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags kyis mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'i mchod pa ni gong gi bdud rtsi la sogs pas rtsa ba'i sngags dang go cha dang rkang pa brgyad pa'i sngags kyis mchod par bya'o //
translated: The secret offering is offering with the root mantra, armor, and the mantra of the eight lines, with the nectar and so forth mentioned above.🔽Om. Homage to the Blessed Vajra Varahi.

original: aom na mo bha ga ba te badzra b'a r'a h'i /
analyzed: aom na mo bha ga ba te badzra b'a r'a h'i /
translated: Noble Aparajita, Mother of the Three Worlds, Great Knowledge Wisdom,🔽Great Vajra, who terrifies all demons.🔽Vajra, unconquered, unvanquished,🔽with the eyes of the blazing garland,🔽with the face of the wrathful one,

original: a'ar+ya aa pa r'a dzi te tree lo kya m'a te ma h'a bid+ye shva ri /
analyzed: a'ar+ya aa pa r'a dzi te tree lo kya m'a te ma h'a bid+ye shva ri /
translated: with the face of the lion,🔽with the face of the elephant,

original: sarba bha ta bha y'a ba he ma h'a badzre /
analyzed: sarba bha ta bha y'a ba he ma h'a badzre /
translated: with the face of the horse,🔽with the face of the bull,🔽with the face of the goat,

original: badzre a'a sa na aa dzi te aa pa r'a dzi te /🔽ba sham ka ri ni ne tra bhr'a ma ni /
analyzed: badzre a'a sa na aa dzi te aa pa r'a dzi te / ba sham ka ri ni ne tra bhr'a ma ni /
translated: with the face of the deer,🔽with the face of the peacock,🔽with the face of the swan,🔽with the face of the cuckoo,🔽with the face of the owl,🔽with the face of the jackal,

original: ro sha ni kro dhe ka r'a li ne /
analyzed: ro sha ni kro dhe ka r'a li ne /
translated: with the face of the wolf,🔽with the face of the dog,🔽with the face of the pig,🔽with the face of the cat,🔽with the face of the monkey,🔽with the face of the mouse,

original: tr'a sa ni m'a ra ni su pra bhe da ni pa r'a dza ye /
analyzed: tr'a sa ni m'a ra ni su pra bhe da ni pa r'a dza ye /
translated: with the face of the snake,🔽with the face of the scorpion,🔽with the face of the spider,🔽with the face of the centipede,🔽with the face of the bee,🔽with the face of the mosquito,🔽with the face of the fish,

original: bi dza ye dzam bha ni stambha ni mo ha ni /
analyzed: bi dza ye dzam bha ni stambha ni mo ha ni /
translated: with the face of the tortoise,🔽with the face of the crab,🔽with the face of the frog,🔽with the face of the crocodile,🔽with the face of the shark,🔽with the face of the swan,🔽with the face of the peacock,🔽with the face of the cock,🔽with the face of the owl,🔽with the face of the elephant,🔽with the face of the horse,🔽with the face of the bull,🔽with the face of the goat,🔽with the face of the deer,🔽with the face of the cat,🔽with the face of the monkey,🔽with the face of the mouse,🔽with the face of the snake,🔽with the face of the scorpion,🔽with the face of the spider,🔽with the face of the centipede,🔽with the face of the bee,

original: badzra p'a r'a h'i ma h'a yo gi n'i k'a me shva ri kha ge //
analyzed: badzra p'a r'a h'i ma h'a yo gi n'i k'a me shva ri kha ge //
translated: Vajra-pāra-hā, great yoginī, grant me the state of a spiritual being.

original: pro tam ge //
analyzed: pro tam ge //
translated: Protector!🔽Kill! Kill!

original: ha na ha na /
analyzed: ha na ha na /
translated: Destroy! Destroy!🔽King! King!🔽Burn! Burn!🔽Vajra-hast!

original: pr'a n'a na /
analyzed: pr'a n'a na /
translated: Dry up! Dry up!🔽Vajra skull-cup, holding a khatvānga,🔽greatly terrifying, with a garland of human entrails,🔽with a garland of human heads,

original: king ki n'i khing khi ni /
analyzed: king ki n'i khing khi ni /
translated: with a garland of heads bound together,

original: dhu na dhu na /
analyzed: dhu na dhu na /
translated: subduing, subduing,🔽killing, killing all evil beings,🔽all enemies,🔽with great wrath,🔽crushing the fierce,🔽great hero,🔽the one who is the essence of the glorious Heruka,

original: badzra ha ste /
analyzed: badzra ha ste /
translated: the one who is the essence of the great,🔽the one who has a thousand heads,🔽the one who has a thousand arms,

original: sho sha ya sho sha ya /🔽badzra ka p'a la kha tv'am ga dh'a ri ni /
analyzed: sho sha ya sho sha ya / badzra ka p'a la kha tv'am ga dh'a ri ni /
translated: the one who has a thousand eyes,

original: @247a * // ma h'a bi shi ta m'am s'a sa ni /
analyzed: @247a * // ma h'a bi shi ta m'am s'a sa ni /
translated: the one who has a thousand powers,🔽the one with a blazing mouth,

original: ma nu sha aantra pr'i bra te /🔽s'a nni d+hya na ra shi ro //
analyzed: ma nu sha aantra pr'i bra te / s'a nni d+hya na ra shi ro //
translated: the one with a garland of blazing skulls,🔽the one with a garland of skulls,🔽the one with a garland of heads,

original: m'a la granthi ta dh'a ri ni /
analyzed: m'a la granthi ta dh'a ri ni /
translated: the one with a garland of hands,🔽the one with a garland of feet,🔽the one with a garland of tongues,

original: sumbha ni sumbhe /
analyzed: sumbha ni sumbhe /
translated: the one with a garland of eyes,🔽the one with a garland of ears,

original: ha na ha na s'a p'a nam /🔽sarba p'a pa sat'a n'am /
analyzed: ha na ha na s'a p'a nam / sarba p'a pa sat'a n'am /
translated: the one with a garland of noses,🔽the one with a garland of teeth,🔽the one with a garland of lips,🔽the one with a garland of heads,🔽the one with a garland of arms,🔽the one with a garland of hands,

original: sarba pa shu n'am /🔽ma h'a m'am sa /🔽tstshe da ni kro dha m'u rti /
analyzed: sarba pa shu n'am / ma h'a m'am sa / tstshe da ni kro dha m'u rti /
translated: the one with a garland of feet,🔽the one with a garland of fingers,🔽the one with a garland of toes,🔽the one with a garland of bones,🔽the one with a garland of skulls,🔽the one with a garland of hair,🔽the one with a garland of hair tufts,

original: dam shdra ka r'a si ni /🔽ma h'a mu dre /
analyzed: dam shdra ka r'a si ni / ma h'a mu dre /
translated: the one with a garland of earrings,🔽the one with a garland of armlets,🔽the one with a garland of anklets,🔽the one with a garland of girdles,

original: sh'ri he ru ka dee ba s+ya /🔽aa gra sa ma hi she /
analyzed: sh'ri he ru ka dee ba s+ya / aa gra sa ma hi she /
translated: the one with a garland of key-rings,

original: sa ha sva shi re /🔽sa ha sa bha ha be /
analyzed: sa ha sva shi re / sa ha sa bha ha be /
translated: the one with a garland of half-moon ornaments,🔽the one with a garland of jewels,

original: sa ta sa ha sra na ne /🔽dzva li ta te dza s+ya /🔽dzva la mu khi /
analyzed: sa ta sa ha sra na ne / dzva li ta te dza s+ya / dzva la mu khi /
translated: the one with a garland of snakes,🔽the one with a garland of skulls,🔽the one with a garland of heads,

original: pingga la lo tsa ni /
analyzed: pingga la lo tsa ni /
translated: the one with a garland of hands,🔽the one with

original: badzra sa r'i re /
analyzed: badzra sa r'i re /
translated: Vajra saraire.

original: badzra a'a sa ne /🔽mi li mi li /
analyzed: badzra a'a sa ne / mi li mi li /
translated: Vajra asane.🔽Mili mili.

original: ti me li ti mi li /
analyzed: ti me li ti mi li /
translated: Timi mili timi mili.

original: he he h'um h'um /🔽kha kha / dhu ru dhu ru dhu ru dhu ru /
analyzed: he he h'um h'um / kha kha / dhu ru dhu ru dhu ru dhu ru /
translated: He he hum hum.🔽Khakha.🔽Dhurudhurudhurudhuru.

original: mu ru mu ru /
analyzed: mu ru mu ru /
translated: Murumuru.

original: aa dre te /
analyzed: aa dre te /
translated: Adrete.

original: ma h'a yo gi n'i /
analyzed: ma h'a yo gi n'i /
translated: Mahayogine.

original: siddhi drem dham drem dham /
analyzed: siddhi drem dham drem dham /
translated: Siddhidramdham dramdham.

original: gram gram / he he ha ha /
analyzed: gram gram / he he ha ha /
translated: Gram gram. He he ha ha.

original: bhe me ha sa ha sa /
analyzed: bhe me ha sa ha sa /
translated: Bhemé hasa hasa.

original: b'i ra h'a h'a /
analyzed: b'i ra h'a h'a /
translated: Virá hahá hahá.

original: ho ho h'um h'um /
analyzed: ho ho h'um h'um /
translated: Ho ho hum hum.

original: tree lo kya bi n'a ni /
analyzed: tree lo kya bi n'a ni /
translated: Tré loka yavani.

original: sha ta sa ha sra ko ti ta th'a ta pa ri w'a re //
analyzed: sha ta sa ha sra ko ti ta th'a ta pa ri w'a re //
translated: Shatasahasra koți tathāgata parivāre.

original: h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: h'um h'um phat /
translated: Hum hum phat.

original: sem ha r'u pe kha: ga dza r'u pe ga: tree lo kya da ri /
analyzed: sem ha r'u pe kha: ga dza r'u pe ga: tree lo kya da ri /
translated: Semha rūpe khakha. Gaja rūpe ghakha. Tré loka daridra.

original: sa mu dra me kha le gra sa gra sa /
analyzed: sa mu dra me kha le gra sa gra sa /
translated: Samudra mekhalé grasa grasa.

original: h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: h'um h'um phat /
translated: Hum hum phat.

original: b'i ra aa dree ta h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: b'i ra aa dree ta h'um h'um phat /
translated: Virádrete hum hum phat.

original: ha ha ma h'a pa shu /
analyzed: ha ha ma h'a pa shu /
translated: Ha ha mahā pāśa.

original: mo ha ni yo g'i shva ri tvam badzra d'a ki n'i /
analyzed: mo ha ni yo g'i shva ri tvam badzra d'a ki n'i /
translated: Mohani yogi śvari tvaṃ vajra dākinī.

original: sarba lo k'a n'am bandha ni sa dya pra dya ya ka ri ni /
analyzed: sarba lo k'a n'am bandha ni sa dya pra dya ya ka ri ni /
translated: Sarva lokānām bandhani sadyaḥ pradaya kariṇi.

original: h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: h'um h'um phat /
translated: Hum hum phat.

original: bh'um ta tr'a sa ni /
analyzed: bh'um ta tr'a sa ni /
translated: Bhūṃ tārasani.

original: ma h'a b'i ree ba ra ma sa ddhi yo g'i shva r'i h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a lha mo'i phreng ba'i sngags ring 'di ni rkang pa brgyad pa mchod pa'i sngags so //
analyzed: ma h'a b'i ree ba ra ma sa ddhi yo g'i shva r'i h'um h'um phat sv'a h'a lha mo'i phreng ba'i sngags ring 'di ni rkang pa brgyad pa mchod pa'i sngags so //
translated: Om vajra-varada-rama-sadhi-yoga-svara hum hum phat svāhā.

original: sngags 'dis mchod pa byas nas //
analyzed: sngags 'dis mchod pa byas nas //
translated: Having made offerings with this mantra,

original: de'i rjes la tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes la tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi bsgom par bya ste /
translated: after that one should meditate on the four abodes of Brahmā.

original: dang po sems can gyi don du bskul ba ni byams pa'o //
analyzed: dang po sems can gyi don du bskul ba ni byams pa'o //
translated: First, the urging for the sake of sentient beings is love.

original: de nas 'khor gyi lha mo rnams khams gsum gyi sems can gyi don du spros te /
analyzed: de nas 'khor gyi lha mo rnams khams gsum gyi sems can gyi don du spros te /
translated: Then, the goddesses of the retinue emanate for the sake of the sentient beings of the three realms.

original: sems can thams cad sdug bsngal dang bral bar byas nas thar pa mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod pa ni snying rje'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad sdug bsngal dang bral bar byas nas thar pa mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod pa ni snying rje'o //
translated: Having freed all sentient beings from suffering and established them in the state of liberation, nirvāṇa, is compassion.

original: de nas lha mo rnams kyis khams gsum gyi sems can thams cad 'khor lo bde mchog gi go 'phang thob par byas nas gdan la byon pa ni dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de nas lha mo rnams kyis khams gsum gyi sems can thams cad 'khor lo bde mchog gi go 'phang thob par byas nas gdan la byon pa ni dga' ba'o //
translated: Then, the goddesses having caused all sentient beings of the three realms to attain the state of Cakrasaṃvara, they return to their seats, which is joy.

original: de nas lha mo de rnams gtso mo la 'dus gtso mo ni sa bon la 'dus /
analyzed: de nas lha mo de rnams gtso mo la 'dus gtso mo ni sa bon la 'dus /
translated: Then, those goddesses dissolve into the principal one, and the principal one dissolves into the seed syllable.

original: sa bon de nyid rnal 'byor pa la 'dus so //
analyzed: sa bon de nyid rnal 'byor pa la 'dus so //
translated: That seed itself is collected into the yogin.

original: de'i rjes la dag pa rnam pa gsum bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la dag pa rnam pa gsum bsgom par bya'o //
translated: After that, one should meditate on the three purities.

original: aom sv'a bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dharm'a: sva bh'a ba shuddho& ham /
analyzed: aom sv'a bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dharm'a: sva bh'a ba shuddho& ham /
translated: Om svabhāva śuddhaḥ sarvadharmāḥ svabhāva śuddho ’ham.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: All phenomena are pure by nature.

original: aom yo ga shuddha: sarba dharm'a yo ga shuddho& ham /
analyzed: aom yo ga shuddha: sarba dharm'a yo ga shuddho& ham /
translated: Om yoga śuddhaḥ sarvadharmā yoga śuddho ’ham.

original: rnal 'byor rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Yoga is pure by nature.

original: aom badzra shuddha: sarba dharm'a badzra shuddho& ham /
analyzed: aom badzra shuddha: sarba dharm'a badzra shuddho& ham /
translated: Om vajra śuddhaḥ sarvadharmā vajra śuddho ’ham.

original: rdo rje rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The vajra is pure by nature.

original: de ltar dag pa gsum bsgom pa ni btang snyoms te //
analyzed: de ltar dag pa gsum bsgom pa ni btang snyoms te //
translated: Thus, meditating on the three purities is equanimity.

original: rgyud bsod nams kyi tshogs la 'bras bu ye shes kyi tshogs kyi rgyas btab par zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud bsod nams kyi tshogs la 'bras bu ye shes kyi tshogs kyi rgyas btab par zhes bya'o //
translated: The continuum of the accumulation of merit is sealed with the result, the accumulation of wisdom.

original: de rjes stong nyid bdag nyid las //
analyzed: de rjes stong nyid bdag nyid las //
translated: After that, from the nature of emptiness,

original: chos 'byung phyag rgya @247b bsgom par bya //
analyzed: chos 'byung phyag rgya @247b bsgom par bya //
translated: one should meditate on the seal of the source of phenomena.

original: de'i dkyil du bam yongs su gyur pa las //
analyzed: de'i dkyil du bam yongs su gyur pa las //
translated: In its center, from a completely transformed vaṃ,

original: rdo rje phag mo bsgom par bya //
analyzed: rdo rje phag mo bsgom par bya //
translated: One should meditate on Vajravarahi.

original: dam tshig sems dpa' gsal nas ni //
analyzed: dam tshig sems dpa' gsal nas ni //
translated: Having visualized the pledge-being,

original: dam tshig sems dpa'i lte ba ru /
analyzed: dam tshig sems dpa'i lte ba ru /
translated: In the center of the pledge-being

original: chos 'byung nyis brtsegs bsgom par bya //
analyzed: chos 'byung nyis brtsegs bsgom par bya //
translated: One should meditate on the double-stacked source of phenomena.

original: de dkyil sa bon yi ge las /
analyzed: de dkyil sa bon yi ge las /
translated: In its center, from the seed syllable,

original: 'od zer rnams ni 'phro bar bsam //
analyzed: 'od zer rnams ni 'phro bar bsam //
translated: One should imagine light rays radiating.

original: ye shes 'khor lo spyan drangs la //
analyzed: ye shes 'khor lo spyan drangs la //
translated: Having invited the awareness beings,

original: mdun gyi nam mkhar bsgom par bya //
analyzed: mdun gyi nam mkhar bsgom par bya //
translated: One should meditate on them in the space in front.

original: dam tshig sems dpa'i sku las ni //
analyzed: dam tshig sems dpa'i sku las ni //
translated: From the body of the pledge-being,

original: lha mo drug po spros pa yis //
analyzed: lha mo drug po spros pa yis //
translated: Having emanated the six goddesses,

original: ye shes 'khor los dbang bskur nas //
analyzed: ye shes 'khor los dbang bskur nas //
translated: Having conferred empowerment on the awareness beings,

original: mchod pa rnams ni dbul bar bsam //
analyzed: mchod pa rnams ni dbul bar bsam //
translated: One should imagine that they offer the offerings.

original: de rjes lha mo rnams ni tshur 'dus nas //
analyzed: de rjes lha mo rnams ni tshur 'dus nas //
translated: After that, the goddesses gather back in,

original: ye shes 'khor lo gzhug par bya ;
analyzed: ye shes 'khor lo gzhug par bya ;
translated: And one should cause the awareness beings to enter.

original: / dza: zhes bya bas dgug h'um gis gzhug / bam gyis bcing /
analyzed: / dza: zhes bya bas dgug h'um gis gzhug / bam gyis bcing /
translated: With “Jaḥ,” one should summon; with “Hūṃ,” one should cause to enter; with “Vaṃ,” one should bind;

original: ho: sa mnyes par bya /
analyzed: ho: sa mnyes par bya /
translated: With “Hoḥ,” one should please.

original: ye shes 'khor lo bcug rjes ni /🔽me dang me ni bsres pa'am //
analyzed: ye shes 'khor lo bcug rjes ni / me dang me ni bsres pa'am //
translated: After the awareness beings have been caused to enter,🔽Like fire being added to fire,

original: chu dang chu ni bsres pa bzhin //
analyzed: chu dang chu ni bsres pa bzhin //
translated: Or water being added to water,

original: de yi bdag nyid bsgom par bya //
analyzed: de yi bdag nyid bsgom par bya //
translated: One should meditate on their identity.

original: de rjes phyi yi rim pa ni //
analyzed: de rjes phyi yi rim pa ni //
translated: Then, the outer stage

original: gsal bar yongs su bsgom par bya //
analyzed: gsal bar yongs su bsgom par bya //
translated: should be visualized clearly.

original: gnas gsum pa ni lhag gis gsal bar bsgom //
analyzed: gnas gsum pa ni lhag gis gsal bar bsgom //
translated: The third place is visualized clearly.

original: srin po'i lam ni cung zhig bsdams //
analyzed: srin po'i lam ni cung zhig bsdams //
translated: The path of the rākṣasa is slightly blocked.

original: chos sku'i ngo bo nyid ni 'od zhu bas /
analyzed: chos sku'i ngo bo nyid ni 'od zhu bas /
translated: The essence of the dharmakāya melts into light

original: bde ba chen pos yongs su gang //🔽de tshe bde stong zung 'jug gis //
analyzed: bde ba chen pos yongs su gang // de tshe bde stong zung 'jug gis //
translated: and is completely filled with great bliss.🔽At that time, the three realms are of one taste

original: khams gsum pa ni ro gcig pa //
analyzed: khams gsum pa ni ro gcig pa //
translated: with the union of bliss and emptiness.

original: phyag rgya chen po ma lus don //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po ma lus don //
translated: The meaning of the entire mahāmudrā

original: gsal bar yongs su bsgom par bya //
analyzed: gsal bar yongs su bsgom par bya //
translated: should be visualized clearly.

original: mthar thug 'bras bu thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: mthar thug 'bras bu thob par 'gyur //
translated: The ultimate result will be attained.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: This is the consciousness of equipoise.

original: rjes thob bde stong gnyis kyi ngang nyid las //
analyzed: rjes thob bde stong gnyis kyi ngang nyid las //
translated: In the state of the subsequent attainment of the union of bliss and emptiness,

original: rtog bral longs spyod sku ni gsal bar bsgom //
analyzed: rtog bral longs spyod sku ni gsal bar bsgom //
translated: the conceptual, enjoyment body is visualized clearly.

original: de rjes do li ltar ni bzlas par bya //
analyzed: de rjes do li ltar ni bzlas par bya //
translated: After that, one should recite like a garland.

original: btu yig rnams kyis sngags rnams dag par bya //
analyzed: btu yig rnams kyis sngags rnams dag par bya //
translated: The mantras are purified by the anusvāra.

original: bzlas pa'i sngags ni sku gsung thugs kyi bzla //
analyzed: bzlas pa'i sngags ni sku gsung thugs kyi bzla //
translated: The mantra of the recitation is the recitation of body, speech, and mind.

original: sku gsum phyag rgya rgyan dang gdan bcas pa //
analyzed: sku gsum phyag rgya rgyan dang gdan bcas pa //
translated: The seal of the three bodies, along with the ornaments and seats,

original: de rnams rnam par dag pa'i rim pa ni //
analyzed: de rnams rnam par dag pa'i rim pa ni //
translated: The stages of their purification

original: gzhan don bla ma'i zhal las shes par bya //
analyzed: gzhan don bla ma'i zhal las shes par bya //
translated: should be known from the guru's instruction for the benefit of others.

original: de rjes gtor ma la sogs bya ba ni //
analyzed: de rjes gtor ma la sogs bya ba ni //
translated: After that, one should perform the bali offering, and so on.

original: snod ni yongs su dag pa las //
analyzed: snod ni yongs su dag pa las //
translated: In the completely pure vessel,

original: ka p'a la'am rin chen snod //
analyzed: ka p'a la'am rin chen snod //
translated: the kapāla or precious vessel,

original: sha lnga dang ni bdud rtsi lnga //
analyzed: sha lnga dang ni bdud rtsi lnga //
translated: the five meats and the five amṛtas

original: de rnams kyi ni sa bon no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi ni sa bon no //
translated: are the seeds of those.

original: go ku da ha na /
analyzed: go ku da ha na /
translated: Go kur da ha

original: bh'um a'am dzr'im kham h'um //
analyzed: bh'um a'am dzr'im kham h'um //
translated: bhuṃ āṃ jriṃ khaṃ hūṃ

original: de nas me rlung sbyor ba bya //
analyzed: de nas me rlung sbyor ba bya //
translated: Then one should perform the yoga of fire and wind.

original: ya las rlung gi 'khor lo //
analyzed: ya las rlung gi 'khor lo //
translated: From ya, there is a wind maṇḍala;

original: ram las me'i dkyil 'khor kam las thod pa gsum //
analyzed: ram las me'i dkyil 'khor kam las thod pa gsum //
translated: from raṃ, there is a fire maṇḍala; from kaṃ, there is a skull.

original: aa las ka p'a la //
analyzed: aa las ka p'a la //
translated: From a, there is a kapāla.

original: de'i nang du gong gi yi ge rnams ni bsam /
analyzed: de'i nang du gong gi yi ge rnams ni bsam /
translated: In that, one should visualize the above syllables.

original: de'i steng du kha t'vam ga mgo thung du blta ba //🔽yu ba la aom rked pa la /
analyzed: de'i steng du kha t'vam ga mgo thung du blta ba // yu ba la aom rked pa la /
translated: Above that, there is a khaṭvāṅga, facing downward,🔽with oṃ on the handle,🔽āḥ on the waist,

original: a'a: rtsa mo la h'um /
analyzed: a'a: rtsa mo la h'um /
translated: and hūṃ on the top.

original: de rnams kha sbyor yi ge bsgom par bya //
analyzed: de rnams kha sbyor yi ge bsgom par bya //
translated: One should visualize the syllables of the union.

original: de rjes de rnams @248a * //🔽sbyangs nas ni //
analyzed: de rjes de rnams @248a * // sbyangs nas ni //
translated: After that, having refined those,

original: ye shes bdud rtsi'i bdag nyid bsgom par bya //
analyzed: ye shes bdud rtsi'i bdag nyid bsgom par bya //
translated: one should meditate on the nature of the gnosis amṛta.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor kha leb byas nas ni //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor kha leb byas nas ni //
translated: Having made the moon-mandala the lid,🔽one should invite the guests,

original: 'jig rten 'jig rten las 'das pa'i //🔽mgron rnams spyan ni drang bar bya //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'jig rten las 'das pa'i // mgron rnams spyan ni drang bar bya //
translated: both mundane and supramundane.

original: lca la rdo rje'i sbu gu bsam //
analyzed: lca la rdo rje'i sbu gu bsam //
translated: One should visualize a vajra tube on the tongue,

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor btsal nas ni //
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor btsal nas ni //
translated: and having sought the moon-mandala,

original: ye shes bdud rtsi gsol bar bsam//
analyzed: ye shes bdud rtsi gsol bar bsam//
translated: one should imagine that one offers the wisdom nectar.

original: 'jig rten 'das pas gsol rjes la //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'das pas gsol rjes la //
translated: After the supramundane [guests] have eaten,

original: 'jig rten pa la dbul bar bya //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa la dbul bar bya //
translated: one should offer [the nectar] to the mundane [guests].

original: de rjes gnas skyod 'byung po rnams la spyin //
analyzed: de rjes gnas skyod 'byung po rnams la spyin //
translated: After that, one should distribute [the nectar] to the spirits who move in the abodes.

original: 'dod pa'i don rnams bsgrub don du //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don rnams bsgrub don du //
translated: For the sake of accomplishing the desired aims,

original: de rnams la ni gsol ba gdab //
analyzed: de rnams la ni gsol ba gdab //
translated: one should supplicate them.

original: de nas rnal 'byor ma'i yi ge brgya bas /
analyzed: de nas rnal 'byor ma'i yi ge brgya bas /
translated: Then, with the yoginī's one-hundred-syllable [mantra],

original: mgron rnams gshegs su gsol bar bya //
analyzed: mgron rnams gshegs su gsol bar bya //
translated: one should request the guests to depart.

original: gtor ma'i sngags ni /
analyzed: gtor ma'i sngags ni /
translated: The bali mantra

original: 'di lta ste //🔽aom badzra aa ralli ho /
analyzed: 'di lta ste // aom badzra aa ralli ho /
translated: is as follows:🔽oṃ vajra-arali ho

original: dza: h'um bam ho: badzra d'a ki n+y'a /
analyzed: dza: h'um bam ho: badzra d'a ki n+y'a /
translated: jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ vajra-ḍākinī

original: sa ma hya stam dri shya ho //
analyzed: sa ma hya stam dri shya ho //
translated: samahaṃ stham dṛśya ho

original: rdo rje thal mo kha ghyen du phye la nam phyed na gtor ma sbyin no //
analyzed: rdo rje thal mo kha ghyen du phye la nam phyed na gtor ma sbyin no //
translated: One should open the vajra palms upward and offer the bali at midnight.

original: aom kha kha kh'a hi kh' hi /
analyzed: aom kha kha kh'a hi kh' hi /
translated: oṃ kha kha khāhi khāhi

original: sarba hya ksha r'a ksha sa bh'u ta pre ta pi sh'a tsa apun m'a da /🔽aa pa sm'a ra d'a ka d'a ki n+ya /
analyzed: sarba hya ksha r'a ksha sa bh'u ta pre ta pi sh'a tsa apun m'a da / aa pa sm'a ra d'a ka d'a ki n+ya /
translated: Sarva hyaksa rakasa bhūta preta piśāca apunar māda.🔽Apa samāra dāka dākinya.

original: da ya ai dam ba lim /
analyzed: da ya ai dam ba lim /
translated: Dāya idam bali.

original: grihna ntu sa ma yam ra ksha ntu /
analyzed: grihna ntu sa ma yam ra ksha ntu /
translated: Gṛhṇantu samayam rakṣantu.

original: sarba siddhi mme pra yatstsha th'a /
analyzed: sarba siddhi mme pra yatstsha th'a /
translated: Sarva siddhim me prayaccha.

original: ya thee bam ya the shtam bhu nydza tha /
analyzed: ya thee bam ya the shtam bhu nydza tha /
translated: Yatheṣṭaṃ yatheṣṭaṃ bhuñja.

original: pi pa ba m'a ti kra ma tha /
analyzed: pi pa ba m'a ti kra ma tha /
translated: Piva māta kṛtaṃ sthāma.

original: ma ma sarba ka ra /
analyzed: ma ma sarba ka ra /
translated: Mama sarva karā.

original: satshu kha bri bri dda ye /
analyzed: satshu kha bri bri dda ye /
translated: Sthāpaya sthāpaya.

original: sa h'a yi ka bha w'am tu h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
analyzed: sa h'a yi ka bha w'am tu h'um phat phat sv'a h'a /
translated: Sahāyikā bhavantu hūṃ phaṭ phaṭ svāhā.

original: gtor ma'i sngags so //
analyzed: gtor ma'i sngags so //
translated: The mantra of the torma.

original: aom badzra yo gi n'i sa tva sa ma ya /
analyzed: aom badzra yo gi n'i sa tva sa ma ya /
translated: Oṃ vajra yoginī satva samaya.

original: ma nu p'a la yam badzra yo g'i n'i sa tva tve no pa tishtha /
analyzed: ma nu p'a la yam badzra yo g'i n'i sa tva tve no pa tishtha /
translated: Manu pālayaṃ vajra yoginī satva tvena upatiṣṭha.

original: dri dho me bha ba /🔽su po sh+yo me bha ba /
analyzed: dri dho me bha ba / su po sh+yo me bha ba /
translated: Dṛdho me bhava.🔽Supoṣyo me bhava.

original: su to sh+yo me bha ba /
analyzed: su to sh+yo me bha ba /
translated: Sutoṣyo me bhava.

original: aa nu ra kato me bha ba /
analyzed: aa nu ra kato me bha ba /
translated: Anurakto me bhava.

original: sarba sidhi mme pra yatstsha /🔽sarba karm'a su /
analyzed: sarba sidhi mme pra yatstsha /🔽sarba karm'a su /
translated: Sarva siddhim me prayaccha.🔽Sarva karma suca me cittaṃ śodhaya.

original: tsame tsatta shri ya: ku ru h'um ha ha ha ha ho: bha ga b'an sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra yo gi n'i m'a me mu nytsa /
analyzed: tsame tsatta shri ya: ku ru h'um ha ha ha ha ho: bha ga b'an sarba ta th'a ga ta badzra yo gi n'i m'a me mu nytsa /
translated: Cakṣustatśrīyaḥ, kuru hūṃ ha ha ha ha hoḥ, bhagavān sarvatathāgatavajrayoginīmamāyāmudrāṃ samayastvaṃ vajra-bhāva māṃ samaya-satva āḥ.

original: badzri bha pa ma m'a sa ma ya sa tva a'a: rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i yi ge brgya pa'o //
analyzed: badzri bha pa ma m'a sa ma ya sa tva a'a: rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i yi ge brgya pa'o //
translated: This is the hundred-syllable mantra of Vajrayoginī.

original: rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i sgrub thabs /
analyzed: rdo rje rnal 'byor ma'i sgrub thabs /
translated: The Sādhana of Vajrayoginī

original: slob dpon chen po dz'a landha ra bas mdzad pa rdzogs so//
analyzed: slob dpon chen po dz'a landha ra bas mdzad pa rdzogs so//
translated: is completed by the great master Jālandhara.
